intro: Psychotria leiocarpa var. genuina, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with white veins, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
